function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of contact with nature in residential buildings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Feeling of being trapped in an apartment during curfew","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impossibility of self-isolation in common areas of the building","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Respondents spending more time in nature or planning to do so","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent weekend \"out of town\" trips recorded by respondents","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decision to buy land for agricultural purposes and real estate outside the city","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preference for living in houses over apartments","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Living in an apartment during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of contact with nature and outdoor space during lockdown","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient state policies related to housing strategies in response to covid-19","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate lighting and ventilation in residential environments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social isolation leading to risks of anxiety, depression, and premature mortality","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in apartment layout for functional reorganization during a pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate open and closed spaces for gatherings and social interaction","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Creating open and closed spaces for gatherings within a building","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower attractiveness of multi-apartment buildings compared to single-family buildings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited options for reorganizing living space in small apartments.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of contact with nature as a drawback of pandemic restrictions on leaving the residence.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper maintenance of green areas leading to the spread of contagious diseases such as vector-borne illnesses","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper sanitation in urban agriculture spaces leading to contamination and spread of foodborne illnesses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation and air quality in multi-family residential buildings with green spaces leading to airborne disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of remote work environment safety measures in multi-purpose urban gardens","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased density and social interaction leading to higher risk of disease transmission in the residential area","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasized flexibility and adaptability of apartment units may lead to frequent rearrangements and changes, increasing the risk of spreading contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Formation of a large number of terraces and gardens increases the potential for social gatherings and close interactions, leading to a higher risk of contagion.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shared common spaces for socialization may become hotspots for disease transmission if not properly managed and maintained.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Open plan apartments and removable partitions may facilitate the spread of increased risk of disease transmission, especially during a pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accessibility via stairs limits access for individuals with mobility restrictions, increasing the risk of excluding this group from the space.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High population density in urban areas increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implementation of urban agriculture may increase the risk of foodborne illnesses if proper hygiene and sanitation practices are not followed.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate common spaces for socialization within the building","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate housing design for pandemic conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of community and engagement within the building","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited adaptability of apartment layouts to changing user needs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to common areas in dense urban areas may hinder the implementation of disease mitigation measures.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower application rate of the resilient residential model may result in suboptimal disease resilience during the pandemic and beyond.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of education and understanding among stakeholders in the design process","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in
